channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside number 8 BRooksville Ave, 2nd September
item.description:
There are two crab apple trees on Brooksville Avenue which are dropping fruit and creating a dangerous, slippy mess on the pavement. It really needs clearing before someone falls.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooksville Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shrubs / Brambles over grown on river walk through to metal bridge/ park, 2nd September
item.description:
The walk way along the rivers edge both side from the stone bridge through passed the metal bridge leading to the park play area all needs cutting back . Female dog Walker walk along there and it’s so over grown you can’t see who’s coming around the corner and with the dark nights approaching it all needs to be open and safe so needs cutting down to ground level . I’m all for wildlife but not at the safety of women walking through there when it’s getting dark with autumn coming . This area hasn’t been cut down in over a year now .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St Georges and union jack flags displayed on all lampposts and others along Sevenoaks Way between Crittalls Corner and railway bridge and beyond, 2nd September
item.description:
I drove down this road on Sunday morning and was appalled to see that all the public columns and posts along here had flags attached. The total amount is overkill, they are unnecessary, visually messy and possibly offensive to some. It is not St Georges Day, a national holiday or a royal event, and this road is certainly not the Mall! they are an eyesore and unauthorised on Council property. One flag is even a Man United football one! please take these flags down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees over grown hanging down by opening facing fishing gates, 2nd September
item.description:
The trees are hanging down to low and coming out to far on the opening to the park so it’s dark and you can’t see who’s in the bushes so with the dark nights coming it needs cutting back please .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
